thread.title: Brexit vote LIVE: MPs to vote on triggering Article 50 to start negotiations to leave the European Union
thread.title_full: Brexit vote LIVE: MPs to vote on triggering Article 50 to start negotiations to leave the European Union

author: Jonathan Walker
title: Brexit vote LIVE: MPs to vote on triggering Article 50 to start negotiations to leave the European Union
text:
Tom Eden Vote expected to pass 
The European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Bill to pave the way for the formal Brexit process to begin under Article 50 is expected to easily clear its first hurdle in the House of Commons on Wednesday evening.But the main Commons skirmishes over the legislation will come during its committee stage from Monday to Wednesday next week, when MPs will scrutinise the Bill in detail and put forward amendments for votes.While Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn has ordered his MPs to back the Bill at second reading tonight, his party will try and add safeguards to the Bill next week. 18:34 Tom Eden Labour backs North East consultation 
Sir Keir Starmer also backed calls for the North East to be consulted about the Brexit process. 
He was responding to comments from Newcastle North MP Catherine McKinnell , who said she wanted to know what discussions the Government has had with the North East about the impact of leaving the single market, “given that 58% of our exports go to the EU.” 18:33 Tom Eden What is the vote about? 
MPs are to hold an historic vote tonight on whether to allow Brexit to go ahead after the SNP, Liberal Democrats and rebel Labour backbenchers launched attempts to block the legislation. 
But laws allowing Prime Minister Theresa May to trigger Brexit appeared certain to be approved, after the Labour leadership urged the party’s MPs to back them. 
Parliament has begun debating the European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Bill, which allows Mrs May to invoke Article 50, the formal mechanism for leaving the EU. 
A vote on the “second reading” of the Bill will be held on Wednesday February 1. If it is approved, there will be further discussion next week in which MPs can attempt to make changes to the legislation. 
Lib Dems, the SNP and a small group of Labour backbenchers, including former leadership candidate Owen Smith, have backed an attempt to stop the Bill. 
But Labour Shadow Brexit Secretary Sir Keir Starmer said his party believed Brexit should go ahead. 18:32 MPs set to vote over Article 50 
MPs will tonight vote on triggering Article 50 to start negotiations about leaving the EU. 
The legislation allowing the Government to trigger Article 50 and start these formal negotiations is expected to pass its first test as it is voted on in the Commons this evening. 
MPs have been debating the bill over the past days, and will tonight have their say. Share
